oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MEASUREMENT OF FRACTURE-TOUGHNESS OF BIMATERIAL INTERFACES AND A STRESS-BASED APPROACH TO THEIR FRACTURE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHANBHAG, MR
ESWARAN, K
MAITI, SK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: strain field
crack
criteria
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The possibility of using a compact tension type of specimen geometry for the measurement of interface fracture toughness for sandwich construction has been examined. Three material pairs have been considered. The fracture toughness data and its variation with the load phase angle are presented. The possibility of specifying the condition for the onset of fracture in terms of the tangential stress at a finite distance ahead of the crack tip is examined. A very encouraging trend is found.
